author: Darla Guillen, Houston Chronicle
title: Severly abused dog now being treated in Harris County
text:
Severely abused dog taken into Harris County Animal Shelter Feb. 4, 2017.

Severely abused dog taken into Harris County Animal Shelter Feb. 4, 2017. Photo: Harris County Animal Shelter Image 9 of 9 Severly abused dog now being treated in Harris County 1 / 9 Back to Gallery 
A stray dog taken to Harris County Animal Shelter in Houston Feb. 4 is finally being treated following a heinous case of animal abuse. 
The two-year-old lab, being called Grace, was walked into the clinic with a harness deeply embedded into its skin and numerous sores, wounds and gashes all over her body. She also has a treatable case of mange and can be seen shaking in a video posted by the shelter. 
Rescue agency Scout's Honor Rescue, Inc. has generously agreed to take in the dog and oversee her medical treatment. 
As of Feb. 5, $7,360 worth in donations had been offered to help cover Grace's medical bills. 
If you would like to donate, please go to paypal.me/texasshelterv. Mention in the notes that the donation is for Grace. 
Grace is currently being cared for until she is available to be adopted. Most Read
